input_text:
Job Title: Recruitment and Admissions Representative

Location: Gilbert, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
The primary purpose of the Recruitment and Admissions Representative is to generate inquiries for Park University and support incoming students in navigating through the entire enrollment process to increase likelihood of attendance. The Recruitment and Admissions Representative works to grow brand awareness and student interest in Park University to yield a desired number of inquiries and applicants annually. This role will also work to maximize the number of students that start at the University. The Recruitment and Admissions Representative will identify potential students who want to start or further their education at Park University as well as initiate and nurture external and internal relationships that influence potential student decision making and increase the likelihood of student attendance.

Position Accountabilities

Deliver enthusiastic Park University presentations and University tours. This position will have goals in relation to the number of external connections and campus tours for the recruitment period. Collect inquiries from all outreach efforts and input on a daily basis. This position will work with supervisor to solidify goals in relation to the number of appointments, inquiries, admits and student starts for each recruitment period. Provide direction and support necessary to increase likelihood of student attendance and enable students to prepare for their first semester of class. This includes coordinating with multiple office effectively to support the students’ progress, questions, and paperwork.Build and implement a strategy and schedule that will create and foster relationships to grow brand awareness and generate student interest in Park University. This requires research and initiative. Provide on-campus (including co-locations: Chandler - Gilbert Community College) communication with prospective students through phone calls, school visits, appointments, emails, text messages and other methods in order to build relationships and assist them with the application and enrollment process on a daily basis. There will be specific seasonal commitments for outbound contact work and events which includes evenings and weekends. Promotes and represents the university at fairs and recruiting events as approved by the Sr Director of Network Academic Success.Responsible for inquiry generation and expected to provide student support throughout the enrollment process from inquiry to day ten of the student’s start term. Communication and student engagement will be extremely important when transitioning students from non-matriculated to a matriculated status. This includes attending, hosting, and executing open house and orientation events, data entry using the University CRM to assure students are admitted and attend Park.This position will cross collaborate with athletic coaches support necessary to increase likelihood of student athlete attendance and enable students to prepare for their first semester of class.


Position Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree required.The ability to be self-motivated while performing a number of different tasks. Must be able to do research and detailed work.Preference given to candidates with advising, marketing, or sales experience.Highly flexible, creative, and able to adapt to new project demands.Strong problem solving skills and strong attention to detail.Preference given to candidates with working knowledge and experience with a wide range of computer technology such as Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel), databases, telephony and constituent relationship management (CRM) systems.Must be able to use specialized software, such as SalesForce.Strong presentation and public speaking skills.Strong interpersonal and written communication skills.Able to work on a non-traditional schedule, specifically evenings and weekends.Access to reliable transportation and the ability to meet the requirements to be an approved Park University vehicle operator.Reside in the assigned territory.


Park University provides a competitive compensation and benefits package including health and life insurance, retirement plan, generous paid time off, and paid undergraduate tuition for employees and dependents. Park University is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from women and minorities.

Qualified applicants must upload a resume and cover letter that includes salary requirements.

Experience Level (if available): None
